artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masadaya Heikichi; Carver: Shimada Tomekichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 289 [unlisted]; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 284.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; standing figure seen from back, pointing with PL hand, with open mouth and face in profile from PL; man is wearing a sleeveless red garment with light red cloud patterns, blue slacks and black boots, and a green and yellow head scarf tied with a white sash; man holds a spear; black column in background at right
markings: Artist’s seal: 号魁斎 {Gō Kaisai} | Carver’s seal: 彫工留吉 {horikō Tomekichi} | Censor seal: 戌二
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Biographies of Valiant Drunken Tigers (Keisei suikoden 競勢酔虎傳
title: Kōmyō-ajari
